revision.text:
{{See also|2009 flu pandemic by country|2009 flu pandemic timeline}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2014}} {{Update|date=October 2009}} {{Main article|2009 flu pandemic}} {{2009 flu pandemic in Asia table}} The '''2009 flu pandemic in Asia''', part of an [[epidemic]] in 2009 of a new strain of [[influenza A virus subtype H1N1]] causing what has been commonly called [[swine influenza|swine flu]], afflicted at least 394,133 [[human|people]] in [[Asia]] with 2,137 confirmed deaths: there were 1,035 deaths confirmed in India, 737 deaths in [[People's Republic of China|China]], 415 deaths in [[Turkey]], 192 deaths in [[Thailand]], and 170 deaths in [[South Korea]]. Among the Asian countries, [[South Korea]] had the most confirmed cases, followed by [[People's Republic of China|China]], [[Hong Kong]], and [[Thailand]]. [[File:H1N1 Asia map.svg|thumb|left|300px|Cases of the A(H1N1) virus in Asia:
{{legend|#000000|Deaths}}{{legend|#cd3412|Confirmed cases}}{{legend|#FFA900|Suspected cases}}{{legend|Silver|No reported cases}}]] [[File:H1N1 Asia map by confirmed deaths.svg|thumb|left|300px|Number of confirmed deaths of A(H1N1) virus in Asia:{{legend|forestgreen|No deaths}}{{legend|#e6e6e6|1+ deaths}}{{legend|#cccccc|5+ deaths}}{{legend|#b3b3b3|10+ deaths}}{{legend|#999999|50+ deaths}}{{legend|#808080|100+ deaths}}{{legend|#666666|500+ deaths}}{{legend|#4d4d4d|1000+ deaths}}{{legend|#333333|5000+ deaths}}]] [[File:H1N1 Asia map by confirmed cases.svg|thumb|left|300px|Number of confirmed cases of A(H1N1) virus in Asia:
{{legend|#111000|50 000+ cases}}{{legend|#550000|5 000+ cases}}{{legend|darkred|500+ cases}}{{legend|#d40000|50+ cases}}{{legend|#ff6666|5+ cases}}{{legend|#ffaaaa|1+ cases}}]] [[File:H1N1 Asia Community Outbreaks.svg|thumb|left|300px|Community Outbreaks in Asia:
{{legend|#ff6600|Community Outbreaks}}]] =={{flag|Azerbaijan}}== On 27 April 2009 [[Azerbaijan]] imposed a ban on import of [[animal husbandry]] products from the [[Americas]].{{cite news|author=|url=http://news-en.trend.az/society/health/1462401.html|agency=[[Trend News Agency|Trend]]|title=Prevention against "swine flu" stabile in Azerbaijan: minister|date=28 April 2009|accessdate=28 April 2009|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090503071442/http://news-en.trend.az/society/health/1462401.html|archivedate=3 May 2009|deadurl=yes|df=dmy-all}} According to the Chief of the State Veterinary Service under the Agriculture Ministry Ismayil Hasanov, products brought to the country on that day received certificates and it was confirmed that those products were safe.{{cite news |author= |url=http://en.apa.az/news.php?id=101346 |agency=[[Azerbaijan Press Agency]] |title=Meeting on swine flu threat held in Azerbaijani Cabinet of Ministers |date=29 April 2009 |accessdate=29 April 2009 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5jfdFvt8l?url=http://en.apa.az/news.php?id=101346 |archivedate=9 September 2009 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} [[AZAL]] took additional safety measures and a sanitary quarantine unit of the Health Ministry started to operate in [[Heydar Aliyev International Airport]] with all aircraft and passengers being checked.{{cite news|author=|url=http://en.apa.az/news.php?id=101254|agency=Azerbaijan Press Agency|title=All aircraft and passengers examined at Heydar Aliyev International Airport|date=28 April 2009|accessdate=29 April 2009|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090503171300/http://en.apa.az/news.php?id=101254|archivedate=3 May 2009|deadurl=yes|df=dmy-all}} Azeri Minister of Health Ogtay Shiraliyev said the order prepared by him considers the implementation of necessary measures in the [[epidemiological]] and various medical centers. "Azerbaijan is ready for this issue", he said.{{cite news|author=|url=http://en.apa.az/news.php?id=101257|agency=Azerbaijan Press Agency|title=Azerbaijani Health Minister: "Special order will be issued regarding the swine flu threat"|date=28 April 2009|accessdate=28 April 2009|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090503171305/http://en.apa.az/news.php?id=101257|archivedate=3 May 2009|deadurl=yes|df=dmy-all}} According to the Agriculture Minister Ismat Abbasov, the State Veterinary Service is holding monitoring in the regions and pigs are kept in closed places in farms. Abbasov also said: "I can say with full responsibility that the situation on prevention against swine flu virus is stable in Azerbaijan". On 31 July, First Case of Influenza A(H1N1) was confirmed. On 2 May all [[Border checkpoint|checkpoints]] on borders with Russia passed to the medium security and disinfection barriers for both cars and pedestrians were installed at the Samur, Shirvanovka and Khan Oba checkpoints in [[Qusar Rayon|Qusar]] and [[Khachmaz Rayon|Khachmaz Raions]].{{cite news|author=|url=http://en.apa.az/news.php?id=101573|agency=[[Azerbaijan Press Agency|APA]]|title=Azerbaijan-Russia border checkpoints pass to medium security|date=2 May 2009|accessdate=2 May 2009|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090503171339/http://en.apa.az/news.php?id=101573|archivedate=3 May 2009|deadurl=yes|df=dmy-all}} The veterinary services at checkpoints intensified their activities while [[Intensive pig farming|hog farm]]s in the northern regions passed to the closed farming regime. =={{flag|Bahrain}}== On 27 April, [[Bahrain]]'s health ministry declared the country to be free from the flu, citing that [[pig farm]]s do not exist in the country and that live pork is not imported into the country.{{cite news|title=Bahrain Flu Free says health ministry|url=http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-198588621.html|accessdate=1 September 2012|newspaper=TradeArabia(via [[HighBeam Research]])|date=27 April 2009}} On 28 April, Bahraini MPs from the [[Al Asalah]] [[Salafi]] party called for the prohibition of pork products in the country.{{cite news|title=Bahraini MPs call for ban on pork.|url=http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-198588655.html|accessdate=1 September 2012|newspaper=Arab News (via [[HighBeam Research]])|date=29 April 2009}} On 30 April, Bahrain banned pork imports from the United States and Mexico where the bulk of its imports originate from, with the Ministry of Health stating that the country is taking extra precautions despite the World Health Organization stating that the flu cannot be contracted via the consumption of pork.{{cite news|title=Bahrain curb on pork imports|url=http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-198826390.html|accessdate=1 September 2012|newspaper=TradeArabia (via [[HighBeam Research]])|date=30 April 2009}} The Ministry announced the creation of [[Isolation (health care)|isolation ward]]s in the country's main hospitals and also recommended that people should avoid hugging and kissing, so as to avoid contact with infected individuals.{{cite news|title=Fever patients quizzed in Bahrain flu alert.|url=http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-198826411.html|accessdate=1 September 2012|newspaper=TradeArabia(via [[HighBeam Research]])|date=30 April 2009}}{{cite news|title='Avoid hugs and kisses' says health officer.|url=http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-198826414.html|accessdate=1 September 2012|newspaper=TradeArabia(via [[HighBeam Research]])|date=30 April 2012}} Also on the same day, it was announced that passengers arriving through the [[Bahrain International Airport]] would be screened and would also send suspicious flu patients to isolation wards. It was also announced that [[pharmacy|pharmacies]] in the country were stockpiled with enough [[Tamiflu]] to cover 20% of the population.{{cite news|title=Municipalities bracing for possible swine flu outbreak.|url=http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-198979086.html|accessdate=1 September 2012|newspaper=Arab News (via [[HighBeam Research]])|date=4 May 2009}} A special hotline was also set up.{{cite news|title=Bahrain launches swine flu hotline.|url=http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-199096377.html|accessdate=1 September 2012|newspaper=Trade Arabia (via [[HighBeam Research]]|date=5 May 2009}} Concerns began to emerge in the country about whether or not the health care sector could handle the influx of flu patients. The Ministry of Health set up screening facilities on the [[King Fahd Causeway]] to screen travelers entering the country.{{cite news|title=Flu vigil 'vital' for Bahrain.|url=http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-199828428.html|accessdate=1 September 2012|newspaper=TradeArabia|date=14 May 2009}} On 1 May, it was announced that a 41-year-old male American traveler and a female passenger from [[Paris]] were quarantined at [[Salmaniya Medical Complex]] after displaying flu-like symptoms. However, both passengers tested negative to H1N1 tests.{{cite news|title=US National is First Suspected Swine Flu Case in Bahrain|url=http://newsblaze.com/story/20090501063148sand.nb/topstory.html|accessdate=1 September 2012|newspaper=News Blaze|date=1 May 2009}} On 26 May, a Bahraini student who had recently arrived from [[New York City|New York]] was confirmed as having contracted the flu; he was the first confirmed case of swine flu to hit the island country.{{cite news|title=Bahrain confirms 1st case of swine flu.|url=http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-200639566.html|accessdate=1 September 2012|newspaper=TradeArabia(via [[HighBeam Research]])|date=26 May 2012}} It is also the first case involving a Gulf national contracting the disease. Health officials have stated the boy had suffered a mild form of the disease and was discharged from the hospital after spending five days in quarantine. On 15 June, seven Bahraini students, all age 17, tested positive for the H1N1 virus.{{cite news|title=7 Bahraini students hit by swine flu.|url=http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-201821328.html|accessdate=1 September 2012|newspaper=TradeArabia|date=15 June 2009}} The students were among a group of students who had recently returned from a [[student exchange]] program in the United States. On 17 June, three more Bahrainis tested positive for the flu, all of whom were in contact with the previous seven students.{{cite news|title=Bahraini swine flu cases rise|url=http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-201970452.html|accessdate=1 September 2012|newspaper=TradeArabia|date=17 June 2009}} In July, the Ministry of Health launched an awareness campaign ahead of the start of the [[academic year]], with many fearing the reopening of schools would lead to a much greater outbreak of the flu.{{cite news|title='Swine flu' alert as schools close for summer.|url=http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-203425388.html|accessdate=1 September 2012|newspaper=Gulf Weekly (via [[HighBeam Research]])|date=12 July 2009}} By early August, 18 confirmed cases of the flu were reported.{{cite news|title=Swine flu fight is on|url=http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-205381130.html|accessdate=1 September 2012|newspaper=Gulf Weekly (via [[HighBeam Research]])|date=9 August 2009}} [[Haj]] travel agencies have reported that thousands of Bahraini pilgrims have cancelled their trips to [[Mecca]] over fears of contracting swine flu. Over 180 confirmed cases of the flu were reported in late August, all of whom had returned from traveling abroad.{{cite news|title=Flu scare hits Umrah trips from Bahrain.|url=http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-206441962.html|accessdate=1 September 2012|newspaper=TradeArabia (via [[HighBeam Research]])|date=23 August 2009}} On 31 August, a 30-year-old Filipino [[maid|housemaid]] died after contracting the H1N1 virus, becoming Bahrain's first confirmed death as a result of the virus.{{cite news|title=Bahrain reports first swine flu death.|url=http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-206967462.html|accessdate=1 September 2012|newspaper=TradeArabia (via [[HighBeam Research]]|date=31 August 2009}} On 3 September, it was reported that a 24-year-old Bahraini man died after succumbing to the H1N1 virus, being the first Bahraini to die of the disease. He was pronounced dead at [[Bahrain Defence Force Hospital|BDF Hospital]] and there were allegations that he had been earlier misdiagnosed by a private hospital.{{cite news|title=Second flu death in Bahrain.|url=http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-207204800.html|accessdate=1 September 2012|newspaper=Trade Arabia (via [[HighBeam Research]])|date=3 September 2009}} On 8 September, it was announced that patients with flu-like symptoms would be treated with [[Tamiflu]] nationwide, regardless of having a fever or not. It was also announced that a million doses of the swine flu vaccine were ordered.{{cite news|title=Bahrain to treat all flu patients with Tamiflu.|url=http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-207493455.html|accessdate=1 September 2012|newspaper=TradeArabia|date=8 September 2009}} The [[Ministry of Education (Bahrain)|Bahraini Ministry of Education]] had decided to postpone the opening of schools until October as a precaution, a decision that drew criticism from the [[World Health Organization]].{{cite news|title=WHO raps Bahrain schools delay.|url=http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-207493512.html|accessdate=1 September 2012|newspaper=TradeArabia (via [[HighBeam Research]])|date=9 September 2009}} In November 2009, the government stated that up to 1,346 cases of the H1N1 virus were confirmed in the country, along with 15,000 suspected cases of the virus.{{cite web|title=Flu cases top 1,346 in Bahrain.|url=http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-212821133.html|publisher=TradeArabia|accessdate=1 September 2012}} =={{flag|Bangladesh}}== It was announced on 29 April 2009 by [[Bangladesh]]'s Health Minister AFM Ruhal Haque that screening of inbound international travelers for swine flu would start at the country's main international airport. After an inter-ministerial meeting on swine flu, Haque told reporters that particularly those travelers who come from the affected countries will be screened at the [[Shahjalal International Airport]] in capital [[Dhaka]]. A Bangladeshi national who recently returned from US has been detected with swine flu on 18 June, making him the first patient to be tested positive of A(H1N1) viral infection in the country.{{cite web| url=http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2009-06/19/content_11568985.htm| title=First A/H1N1 flu case detected in Bangladesh | date= 19 June 2009| publisher=Xinhua| accessdate= 22 October 2009 }} As of 22 August 98 cases of the A(H1N1) virus has been confirmed in Bangladesh.[http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2009-08/22/content_11926144.htm Number of A/H1N1 flu cases up to 98 in Bangladesh_English_Xinhua] =={{flag|Burma|1974}} (Myanmar)== On 1 May 2009 Chairman of Global Human Flu Prevention and Response Work Committee Deputy Minister for Health Dr Mya Oo inspected preventive measures against the human flu at [[Yangon International Airport]], Burma (also known as Myanmar). On 27 June, Burmese state-run Radio Myanmar confirmed the first case of influenza A/H1N1 - a girl aged 13 who just return from a trip from Singapore.{{cite web| url=http://english.people.com.cn/90001/90782/90880/6687904.html| title=Myanmar reports first A/H1N1 flu| date= 28 June 2009| publisher=The People's Daily| accessdate= 22 October 2009 }}{{cite news|url=https://www.wsj.com/article/BT-CO-20090627-701432.html |title=Myanmar Confirms First H1N1 Case |date=27 June 2009 |publisher=Wall Street Journal |accessdate=22 October 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090701091810/http://online.wsj.com/article/BT-CO-20090627-701432.html |archivedate=1 July 2009 }} =={{flag|Cambodia}}== [[File:H1N1 in Cambodia.svg|200px|thumb|right|Spread of H1N1 in Cambodia]] Cambodia's health authorities remain alert but confident that the country is prepared for a swine flu pandemic. In terms of ensuring that infected pigs do not spread the disease to Cambodia, the Cambodian Pig Raiser Association said it has told the government it should ban live pig imports. But Khlauk Chuon, the deputy director of Camcontrol at the Ministry of Commerce, said they would only ban live pig imports from a country that has been hit with swine flu.
"We are very worried about this new disease because it can transfer from pig to human, from human to human and from human to pig," Khlauk Chuon added. 6 cases has been confirmed in Cambodia, including one domestic case.{{cite web|url=http://www.phnompenhpost.com/index.php/2009042925585/National-news/Regional-flu-cases-cause-concern.html|title=Regional flu cases cause concern |publisher= phnompenhpost.com |date=29 April 2009 |accessdate=29 April 2009}}{{cite web|url=http://www.straitstimes.com/Breaking%2BNews/SE%2BAsia/Story/STIStory_396137.html |title=1st domestic case in Cambodia |publisher=Straits Times |date= |accessdate=27 June 2009 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090628220200/http://www.straitstimes.com/Breaking%2BNews/SE%2BAsia/Story/STIStory_396137.html |archivedate=28 June 2009 |deadurl=yes |df= }} =={{flag|China}} ([[People's Republic of China]]){{anchor|China (People's Republic of China)}}== [[File:H1N1 China map.svg|thumb|right|Outbreak evolution in mainland China: {{legend|#cd3512|Confirmed Cases}}{{legend|#000000|Confirmed Deaths}}]] {{See also|Disease surveillance in China}} The first suspected case found on mainland China was reported on 10 May 2009.[http://www.seattlepi.com/health/1500ap_as_china_swine_flu.html SeattlePI]{{dead link|date=December 2010}} As of 29 July 2009, the number of confirmed A/H1N1 cases on the Chinese mainland topped 2,000, with no deaths or serious cases reported, according to the Ministry of Health (MOH). Of the total 2,003 confirmed cases, 1,853 had recovered, said a statement on the [http://www.moh.gov.cn/ MOH website]. The [[General Administration of Quality Supervision, Inspection and Quarantine]] (AQSIQ) of China issued an emergency notice on the evening of 26 April that visitors returning from flu-affected areas who experienced flu-like symptoms within two weeks would be quarantined.{{cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/europeCrisis/idUST344175|title=FACTBOX-Asia moves to ward off new flu virus|publisher=Reuters|date=9 February 2009|accessdate=26 April 2009| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090430041910/https://www.reuters.com/article/europeCrisis/idUST344175| archivedate= 30 April 2009 | deadurl= no}} The [[Ministry of Health of the People's Republic of China|Ministry of Health]] has started prevention measures, and initiated cooperation with the [[World Health Organization|WHO]] and the relevant departments of the Mexican and U.S. governments to help contain the outbreak. According to Wang Jing of the China Inspection and Quarantine Science Research Institute, the measures already in place in China against [[Avian influenza|bird flu]] are sufficient for this new disease, also certain lessons were learned from the [[Severe acute respiratory syndrome|2003 SARS outbreak]] including that the state-controlled media doesn't cover up such events.{{cite web|url=https://ottawacitizen.com/Health/Canadian+cases+swine+Health+officials/1535987/story.html |title=Four 'mild' cases of swine flu confirmed in Nova Scotia |publisher=Ottawacitizen.com |date= |accessdate=26 April 2009 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090429101327/http://www.ottawacitizen.com/Health/Canadian%2Bcases%2Bswine%2BHealth%2Bofficials/1535987/story.html |archivedate=29 April 2009 |deadurl=yes |df= }} 2 May, the [[Government of the People's Republic of China|Chinese government]] has decided to suspend flights from Mexico to [[Shanghai]], the Foreign Ministry said.{{cite web|url=http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2009-05/02/content_11297034.htm|title=China suspends flights from Mexico|publisher=XinHua|date=|accessdate=2 May 2009| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090503205713/http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2009-05/02/content_11297034.htm| archivedate= 3 May 2009 | deadurl= no}} Meanwhile, the [[Civil Aviation Administration of China]] also assigned a charter to transport stranded Chinese visitors back home. Among all carriers, [[China Eastern Airlines]] was the first choice as it is based in Shanghai, where the original and the only Sino-Mexican flight disembarks, but later the job has fallen onto the [[Guangzhou]] based [[China Southern Airlines]], as China Eastern's aircraft don't fit the facility at [[General Abelardo L. Rodríguez International Airport|Tijuana Airport]]. The replacing China Southern flight would leave [[Guangzhou Baiyun International Airport|Guangzhou]] at 21:00 on 3 May as a normal flight until it reaches the stop-over at Los Angeles, and then fly empty toward Mexico City to pick up the 120 stranded tourists. The charter flight estimates to be back in Shanghai 11:00 in the morning on 5 May, and all passengers on board will then go through health to see if further action is needed. 1,089 cases were confirmed in China by early May.{{cite web|url=http://news.xinhuanet.com/newscenter/2009-05/02/content_11300720.htm|title=China Southern charter picking up 120 Chinese visitors in Mexico on May 5|publisher=XinHua|date=|accessdate=2 May 2009| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090505132113/http://news.xinhuanet.com/newscenter/2009-05/02/content_11300720.htm| archivedate= 5 May 2009 | deadurl= no}} {{Link language|zh}} China's Ministry of Health has gathered experts to draft the Influenza A(H1N1) vaccine and immunity strategy which would include, 'when, how and against whom' the vaccine should be used.{{cite web|url=http://www.bernama.com/bernama/v5/newsgeneral.php?id=421736|title=China To Draft Flu Vaccine And Immunity Strategy|publisher=Bernama|date=29 June 2009|accessdate=29 June 2009}} The ministry's Contingency Office deputy director, Liang Wannian, said the optimum objective of the flu vaccine was for the protection of high-risk population, especially people with basic illness and pregnant women. The first batch of China's A (H1N1) flu vaccine is expected to be ready by July, and would undergo a two-month clinical test before it is available in the market. China's flu vaccine strategy is to stockpile enough vaccine for one per cent of her population by 1 October, as a preventive measure to encounter any vast outbreak of the flu. Liang said China would take more severe and effective preventive measures at its many gateways and educate the people on the H1N1, also known as swine flu. In early September 2009, China's [[State Food and Drug Administration]] granted approval to a homegrown [[swine influenza|swine flu]] vaccine, which producer [[Sinovac Biotech]] claims is effective after only one dose.{{cite web|url=http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2009-09/03/content_11990303.htm |publisher=Xinhua |title=China's Sinovac gets world's first production license for A/H1N1 flu vaccine |accessdate=8 September 2009 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5jgeZrXkH?url=http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2009-09/03/content_11990303.htm |archivedate=10 September 2009 |deadurl=no |df=dmy }}[http://news.smh.com.au/breaking-news-world/china-approves-homegrown-swine-flu-vaccine-20090903-f9cr.html (''The Sydney Morning Herald'')] On 4 January 2010, the [[Chinese Health Ministry]] announced that 659 deaths from swine flu have been recorded in 2009, with 120,940 confirmed detected cases throughout the year.{{cite news|url=http://www.straitstimes.com/BreakingNews/Asia/Story/STIStory_473482.html|title=China records 659 flu deaths|last=Breaking News|first=AFP|date=4 January 2010|work=Agence France-Presse|publisher=The Straits Times|accessdate=9 January 2010| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20100108053233/http://www.straitstimes.com/BreakingNews/Asia/Story/STIStory_473482.html| archivedate= 8 January 2010 | deadurl= yes}} =={{flag|Cyprus}}== Cyprus identified its first case of H1N1 on 30 May in a 39-year-old woman from [[Moldova]], living in Cyprus, who returned from the United States on 28 May. As of 11 July 250 cases have been confirmed in Cyprus.http://ecdc.europa.eu/en/Health_topics/novel_influenza_virus/2009_Outbreak/Outbreak_new_table.aspx {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090716071005/http://ecdc.europa.eu/en/Health_topics/novel_influenza_virus/2009_Outbreak/Outbreak_new_table.aspx |date=16 July 2009 }} =={{flag|Hong Kong}}== {{Main article|2009-2010 flu pandemic in Hong Kong}} [[File:H1N1 Hong Kong Map.svg|thumb|right|Outbreak evolution in Hong Kong:
{{legend|#FF0000|Confirmed cases}}]] [[File:Hong Kong H1N1 cumulative frequency.png|thumb|right|Culmulative confirmed cases per day]] [[File:HK MetroparkHotelWanchai swine flu 2.jpg|thumb|right|Metropark Hotel Wanchai under swine flu quarantine]] The [[Food and Health Bureau]] of [[Hong Kong]]{{cite web |url=http://www.chp.gov.hk/view_content.asp?lang=en&info_id=16615 |title=Latest News of Center for Health Protection |publisher=Centre for Health Protection, Hong Kong |publisher=Chp.gov.hk |date= |accessdate=2 May 2009 }}{{Dead link|date=September 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} issued travel advice for Mexico on 26 April 2009, which advised Hong Kong residents not to travel to Mexico unless absolutely necessary. The first case reported was a Mexican who flew in from [[Shanghai]]. The most recent case (the tenth) was found in a 56-year-old American who had flown in from [[San Francisco]].{{cite web|url=http://www.fhb.gov.hk/en/press_and_publications/press/2009/press090426a.htm |title=Secretary for Food and Health on the issue of swine flu (press releases) |publisher=Fhb.gov.hk |date=26 April 2009 |accessdate=2 May 2009}} The Bureau also escalated the alert level from "alert" to "serious" on the same day,{{cite web |url=http://sc.info.gov.hk/gb/www.news.gov.hk/en/category/healthandcommunity/090426/html/090426en05004.htm |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5hLEaDUZP?url=http://sc.info.gov.hk/gb/www.news.gov.hk/en/category/healthandcommunity/090426/html/090426en05004.htm |archivedate=7 June 2009 |title=Swine flu alert raised to 'serious' |publisher=Sc.info.gov.hk |date=26 April 2009 |accessdate=2 May 2009 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} which activated health protection measures in all [[port of entry|ports of entry]] of Hong Kong. As such, temperature screening machines are used at all checkpoints to identify passengers with fever and respiratory symptoms. Any passenger who fails the temperature test and confirmed having a fever will be quarantined and sent to public hospital for further investigation. Hong Kong also became one of the first jurisdictions to declare swine flu as a [[notifiable disease]], and much of the procedures against the spread of the swine flu were learned from the [[Severe acute respiratory syndrome|2003 SARS outbreak]], of which Hong Kong was the epicenter of the outbreak.{{cite web|url=http://www.channelnewsasia.com/stories/eastasia/view/425512/1/.html|title=HK steps up SARS-like emergency precautions against swine flu |last=Tang|first=Leslie|date=28 April 2009|publisher=Channel News Asia|accessdate=29 April 2009}}{{cite news|url=http://www.time.com/time/health/article/0,8599,1894072,00.html?iid=tsmodule |title=The Lessons from SARS |last=Webley |first=Kayla |date=27 April 2009 |publisher=Time |accessdate=29 April 2009 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090430111642/http://www.time.com/time/health/article/0%2C8599%2C1894072%2C00.html?iid=tsmodule |archivedate=30 April 2009 |deadurl=no |df= }} The [[Secretary for Food and Health]] [[York Chow]] stated that special attention will be paid to passengers who come from countries where human infection of swine influenza cases have been reported. On 1 May, one case became the first confirmed case of swine flu in Hong Kong and also the first in Asia after being tested positive by [[the University of Hong Kong]] and the [[Department of Health of Hong Kong]]. The Mexican patient, who travelled with two companions from Mexico to Hong Kong with a stopover in Shanghai [[Pudong Airport]], arrived in Hong Kong on 30 April. Metropark Hotel [[Wanchai]], where the patient stayed, was cordoned off by the police and health officials from the [[Centre for Health Protection]].{{cite web |url=http://www.rthk.org.hk/rthk/news/englishnews/news.htm?main&20090501&56&578437 |title=Emergency in force after case confirmed| publisher=Radio Television Hong Kong |date=1 May 2009 |accessdate=1 May 2009| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090503091908/http://www.rthk.org.hk/rthk/news/englishnews/news.htm?main&20090501&56&578437| archivedate= 3 May 2009 | deadurl= no}}{{cite news |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/latestCrisis/idUST24603| title=Hong Kong govt confirms first H1N1 flu case | publisher=Reuters |date=1 May 2009 |accessdate=1 May 2009| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090503210320/https://www.reuters.com/article/latestCrisis/idUST24603| archivedate= 3 May 2009 | deadurl= no}}{{cite web |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pid=20601080&sid=aKgrGEIztqyQ&refer=asia| title=Hong Kong Confirms Swine Flu Case, Declares Emergency | publisher=Bloomberg |date=1 May 2009 |accessdate=1 May 2009}}{{cite web |url=http://www.chp.gov.hk/view_content.asp?lang=en&info_id=16785| title=SFH on human swine flu press conference on 1/5 | publisher=Centre for Health Protection, Hong Kong|date=1 May 2009| accessdate= 22 October 2009 }} All 350 guests and hotel staff have to remain inside the hotel for seven days. After the first swine flu case was confirmed by laboratory, Chief Executive [[Sir Donald Tsang]] raised Hong Kong's response level from "serious" to "emergency".{{cite web|url=http://www.news.gov.hk/en/category/healthandcommunity/090501/html/090501en05004.htm |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5hLEg4fzu?url=http://www.news.gov.hk/en/category/healthandcommunity/090501/html/090501en05004.htm |archivedate=7 June 2009 |title=1st H1N1 case confirmed in HK |publisher=News.gov.hk |date= |accessdate=2 May 2009 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy }} On 2 May, a total of 12 Metropark Hotel guests who were not willing to stay in the hotel were moved to Lady MacLehose Holiday Village in Sai Kung for quarantine.{{cite web |url=http://www.info.gov.hk/gia/general/200905/02/P200905020026.htm| title=Lodgers of Metropark Hotel moved to holiday village | publisher=Hong Kong SAR Government|date=2 May 2009| accessdate= 22 October 2009 }} On 11 June, the [[Educational Bureau]] issued a letter ordering all kindergartens, primary and special schools to suspend all class and examinations for a 14-day period. As of 21, 20 June secondary schools have been ordered to suspend classes and examinations for another 14 days after a confirmed case of human swine flu was found in each school.On 23 June, the Educational Bureau issued a letter to order all kindergartens, primary schools and special schools to have their summer holiday immediately. As of 27 August 2009, there have been 10,468 confirmed cases of swine flu in the city.{{cite web |url=http://www.chp.gov.hk/files/pdf/Daily_update_on_swine_influenza_bilingual.pdf |title=Update on Human Swine Influenza |publisher=[[Centre for Health Protection]] |date=14 June 2009 |accessdate=27 August 2009 |format=PDF |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5k6aUSTId?url=http://www.chp.gov.hk/files/pdf/Daily_update_on_swine_influenza_bilingual.pdf |archivedate=27 September 2009 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} On 3 July, a case of [[Tamiflu]]-resistant virus was discovered in a woman suffering from the flu. The woman had not previously taken Tamiflu, so concern has been expressed that she may have contracted an already resistant virus from someone else.Canadian Press, [https://www.google.com/hostednews/canadianpress/article/ALeqM5jb6J6PJB7Burz1l0V3UoN6Q7mYOA "Tamiflu resistant H1N1 from Hong Kong more worrying than earlier findings"], ''Helen Branswell'', 6 July 2009 {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090717071103/https://www.google.com/hostednews/canadianpress/article/ALeqM5jb6J6PJB7Burz1l0V3UoN6Q7mYOA |date=17 July 2009 }} =={{flag|India}}{{anchor|India}}== [[File:H1N1 India map.svg|thumb|right|H1N1 in India]] {{Main article|2009-2010 flu pandemic in India}} The [[Government of India]] has decided to screen all people entering India via the main airport hubs of [[Mumbai]], [[New Delhi]], [[Goa]], [[Jaipur]], [[Kochi, India|Kochi]], [[Kolkata]], [[Chennai]], [[Bangalore]] and [[Hyderabad, Andhra Pradesh|Hyderabad]]. It said the primary focus will be on passengers entering from the [[United States of America]], United Kingdom, Canada, Mexico, France, and New Zealand. A team of 32 medical professionals have been posted at these airports. The Ministry of Health is also trying to track down people who have entered India from Mexico in the last 10 days.{{cite news|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/India/American--European-visitors-to-be-screened-for-swine-flu/articleshow/4457075.cms | title=American & European visitors to be screened for swine flu | publisher=Times Of India | date=28 April 2009 | first1=Kounteya | last1=Sinha| accessdate= 22 October 2009 }} It has been reported that one person recently traveled from Texas to Hyderabad with flu symptoms and was quarantined, but authorities refused to divulge his identity.{{cite news|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/Swine-flu-reaches-India/articleshow/4465683.cms |title=NRI from Texas arrives in Hyderabad with swine flu symptoms - India - The Times of India |publisher=Timesofindia.indiatimes.com |date= 30 April 2009|accessdate=30 April 2009}} Government health officials & WHO subsequently stated that there is no Swine flu in India and the said patient recovered from a common cold.{{cite news|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/India/No-swine-flu-in-India-Government/articleshow/4468614.cms |title=Flu watch: NRI test result in 2 days - India - The Times of India |publisher=Timesofindia.indiatimes.com |date= 1 May 2009|accessdate=1 May 2009 |first1=Kounteya |last1=Sinha}} Three other suspected cases of swine flu have been noticed.{{cite news|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/3-suspected-cases-of-swine-flu-in-India/articleshow/4474629.cms |title=3 suspected cases of swine flu in India |publisher=TimesofIndia.Indiatimes.com |date= 2 May 2009|accessdate=2 May 2009 |first1=Kounteya |last1=Sinha}} Two of them were flying from Chicago and the other one, who is UK citizen, aged 35, arrived from London. All of whom have been kept under observation in a hospital.{{cite web|url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/swine-flu-scare-in-india-2-under-observation/91610-17.html |title=Swine flu scare in India, 2 under observation |date= |accessdate=2 May 2009| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090503092014/http://ibnlive.in.com/news/swine-flu-scare-in-india-2-under-observation/91610-17.html| archivedate= 3 May 2009 | deadurl= no}} As of 21 August 2009, 2401 cases have been confirmed in India with 63 deaths.{{cite web|url=http://sify.com/news/fullstory.php?a=jhhvaDdfhgb&title=Eight_new_swine_flu_cases_total_in_India_153 |title=Eight new swine flu cases, total in India 153 |date =|accessdate=7 July 2009}} As of 4 October 2009, 10375 cases have been confirmed in India with 329 deaths.{{Citation needed|date=October 2009}} The maximum deaths are found from [[Pune]]. As of 13 August 13 people have been succumbed to the deadly virus in [[Pune]]. [[Pune]] has been declared onto a state of semi-emergency of pandemic.{{cite web|url=http://ibnlive.in.com/news/swine-flu-kills-2-more-in-pune-toll-8/98941-17.html |title=Swine Flu kills 2 more in Pune, toll 8| accessdate= 22 October 2009 }} The Government has declared of the closure of Schools and Colleges in [[Mumbai]] for at least a week. All the shopping malls and theaters have been closed down up to Monday. =={{flag|Indonesia}}== [[File:H1N1 in Indonesia.svg|thumb|400px|Outbreak evolution in Indonesia:
{{legend|#FF0000|Confirmed cases}}{{legend|#000000|Deaths}}]] After a coordination meeting about the flu on 27 April 2009, the [[Indonesia]]n government halted the importation of pigs and initiated the examination of 9 million pigs in Indonesia.{{cite web|url=http://nasional.kompas.com/read/xml/2009/04/27/11120229/cegah.flu.babi.pemerintah.gelar.rapat.koordinasi|title=Cegah flu babi, pemerintah gelar rapat koordinasi|date=27 April 2009|publisher=Kompas newspaper| accessdate= 22 October 2009 }} [[Thermal scanner]]s which can detect human body temperature have been installed at Indonesian ports of entry. Temperatures above 38 degrees Celsius (100.4 Fahrenheit) cause the devices to beep, indicating fever. The devices have been installed in [[Soekarno-Hatta International Airport]] and Halim Perdana Kusuma Airport in [[Jakarta]], Juanda Airport in [[Surabaya]], Hang Nadim Airport in [[Batam]], Hasanudin Airport in [[Makassar]], Ngurah Rai Airport in [[Denpasar]], Sultan Aji Muhammad Sulaiman Airport in [[Balikpapan]], and Tanjung Priok Seaport, gates one and two in Jakarta and taking action right now. Indonesia confirms first case of H1N1. 416 cases and one death has been confirmed in Indonesia.{{cite web|url=http://www.kompas.com/read/xml/2009/04/27/13282547/Takut.Flu.Babi..Indonesia.Hentikan.Impor.Babi|title=Takut flu babi, Indonesia hentikan impor babi|date=27 April 2009|publisher=Kompas newspaper|accessdate=22 October 2009|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090430103045/http://www.kompas.com/read/xml/2009/04/27/13282547/Takut.Flu.Babi..Indonesia.Hentikan.Impor.Babi|archive-date=30 April 2009|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} Cases have increased to over 1,005 people and 4 deaths, but three of these deaths were reported '''negative'''. Any person with temperatures above 38 degrees Celsius will be taken to a specialized hospital and would undertake intensive test to determine if the patient is positive of swine flu. As of 18 August 2009, 4 deaths due to the virus have been reported in the country. This is not the case, as only one fatality was reported positive to the virus. The other three were signaled negative. =={{flag|Israel}} and the [[West Bank]]{{anchor|Israel and the West Bank}}== [[File:H1N1 Israel map.svg|thumb|75px|Outbreak evolution in Israel and the West Bank:
{{legend|#FF0000|Confirmed cases}}{{legend|#FFA900|Unconfirmed or suspected cases}}]] over 4000 cases have been confirmed in Israel, and over 60 people have died so far.http://www.ynetnews.com/articles/0,7340,L-3813353,00.html In response to the outbreak, the Israeli Deputy [[Health Minister of Israel|Minister of Health]], [[Yaakov Litzman]], has said that because ''swine'' are unclean, the outbreak needs to be renamed, and so in Israel, out of respect for the religious sensibilities of Jews and Muslims, it should be called "Mexican Flu". This was done so as to not confuse the population into thinking that they could not acquire the virus if they did not eat pork.BBC News, [http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/americas/8021301.stm "Israel renames unkosher swine flu"], 27 April 2009 . Retrieved 28 April 2009.Yahoo News, [https://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20090427/ap_on_re_mi_ea/ml_odd_israel_kosher_flu;_ylt=AoAo.o5QnYgbst8ovND83ANvaA8F "Israeli official: Swine flu name offensive"] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090502072711/http://news.yahoo.com/s/ap/20090427/ap_on_re_mi_ea/ml_odd_israel_kosher_flu |date=2 May 2009 }}, Associated Press, 27 April 2009 . Retrieved 28 April 2009. The Israeli government retracted this proposal following Mexican complaints.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2009/apr/28/mexican-swine-flu-pork-name |title=What's in a name? Governments debate 'swine flu' versus 'Mexican flu' | World news | guardian.co.uk |publisher=Guardian |date= 28 April 2009|accessdate=30 April 2009 | location=London | first=Ed | last=Pilkington| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090501104953/http://www.guardian.co.uk/world/2009/apr/28/mexican-swine-flu-pork-name| archivedate= 1 May 2009 | deadurl= no}} The flu came close to many Israeli politicians. Prime minister [[Benjamin Netanyahu]]{{cite web|url=http://reshet.ynet.co.il/חדשות/News/Politics/Politics/Article,21442.aspx|script-title=he:ביבי הבריז ללבני? זה בגלל שפעת החזירים|publisher=Reshet|language=Hebrew|date=19 June 2009}} was checked for fear of flu, and the flu reached the [[President of Israel#Presidential residence|presidential residence]]{{cite web |url=http://www.nrg.co.il/online/1/ART1/904/658.html|script-title=he:בבית הנשיא מתכוננים לשפעת החזירים. |language=Hebrew |publisher=[[nrg Maariv]]|date=16 June 2009| accessdate= 22 October 2009 }} and the [[Knesset]].{{cite web|url=http://www.nrg.co.il/online/1/ART1/900/768.html|script-title=he:עוזר הח"כ שנדבק בשפעת: הלחץ מיותר|language=Hebrew |publisher=[[nrg Maariv]]|date=8 June 2009| accessdate= 22 October 2009 }} =={{flag|Japan}}== [[File:H1N1 Japan Map.svg|thumb|200px|left|H1N1 in Japan]] {{Main article|2009 flu pandemic in Japan}} The [[Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries (Japan)|Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Fisheries]] of Japan instructed animal quarantine offices across Japan to examine any live pigs being brought into Japan to make sure they are not infected with the influenza.{{cite news|url=http://home.kyodo.co.jp/modules/fstStory/index.php?storyid=435522 |title=Japan on high alert for swine flu after outbreak in Mexico |publisher=[[Kyodo News]] |date=26 April 2009 |accessdate=26 April 2009 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090429203043/http://home.kyodo.co.jp/modules/fstStory/index.php?storyid=435522 |archivedate=29 April 2009 |deadurl=yes |df= }} Japanese Agriculture Minister [[Shigeru Ishiba]] appeared on television to reassure customers that it is safe to eat pork. The Japanese farm ministry said that it would not ask for restrictions on pork imports because the virus was unlikely to turn up in pork, and would be killed by cooking.{{cite news |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/europeCrisis/idUST344175 |title=FACTBOX-Asia moves to ward off new flu virus |date=26 April 2009 |agency=Reuters| accessdate= 22 October 2009 }} On 30 April 2009, the first suspected case was detected at [[Narita Airport]]. However, the case turned out to be a conventional strain of influenza A subtype H3N2 (Hong Kong A strain).{{cite web|url=http://www.yomiuri.co.jp/feature/20090425-436828/news/20090430-OYT1T01003.htm |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5hLEqcJc7?url=http://www.yomiuri.co.jp/feature/20090425-436828/news/20090430-OYT1T01003.htm |archivedate=7 June 2009 |title=A female passenger having arrived from Los Angeles was suspected of the new influenza |publisher=[[Yomiuri Shimbun]] |date=30 April 2009 |accessdate=1 May 2009 |deadurl=no |df=dmy }} On 1 May 2009, the second suspected case was detected in Yokohama.{{cite news |url=http://home.kyodo.co.jp/modules/fstStory/index.php?storyid=436501 |title=Japan's 1st suspected case of new influenza virus detected|publisher=[[Kyodo News]] |date=1 May 2009 |accessdate=1 May 2009| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090503161643/http://home.kyodo.co.jp/modules/fstStory/index.php?storyid=436501| archivedate= 3 May 2009 | deadurl= no}} This case also turned out to be a conventional strain of influenza A subtype H1N1 (Russian A strain).{{cite news|url=http://www.yomiuri.co.jp/national/news/20090501-OYT1T00789.htm |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5hLEs0Q6s?url=http://www.yomiuri.co.jp/national/news/20090501-OYT1T00789.htm |archivedate=7 June 2009 |title=Yokohama high school student confirmed to be not carrying the new influenza |publisher=[[Yomiuri Shimbun]] |date=1 May 2009 |accessdate=1 May 2009 |deadurl=no |df=dmy }} Meanwhile, Japan has not stopped any flights or means of travelling between Japan and Mexico. On 8 May, the first three cases were confirmed. The infected patients had spent time in [[Oakville, Ontario|Oakville]], Canada and returned to Japan via [[Detroit]].{{cite news |title=Japáo confirma primeiros três casos de gripe H1N1 |url=http://oglobo.globo.com/mundo/mat/2009/05/08/japao-confirma-primeiros-tres-casos-de-gripe-h1n1-755778368.asp |agency=O Globo|date=8 May 2009 |accessdate=8 May 2009 |language=Portuguese}}{{cite news|title=Japan confirms 3 cases of new flu strain |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/latestCrisis/idUST50010 |publisher=Reuters |date=8 May 2009 |accessdate=9 May 2009 |first=Yoko |last=Kubota |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090515232344/https://www.reuters.com/article/latestCrisis/idUST50010 |archivedate=15 May 2009 |deadurl=no |df=dmy }} On 10 May, another case was confirmed from a student who came from a school trip to Canada, making it the fourth case of Japan.{{cite news|title=NHK- Japan Confirms 4th Case Of Swine Flu |url=http://www.pacificnewscenter.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=7824:japan-records1st-swine-flu-case&catid=34:guam&Itemid=141 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090715100127/http://www.pacificnewscenter.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=7824%3Ajapan-records1st-swine-flu-case&catid=34%3Aguam&Itemid=141 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=15 July 2009 |agency=Pacific News Center |date=10 May 2009 |accessdate=10 May 2009 |df= }} On 16 May, the first domestic infection was confirmed in [[Kobe]]. The male high school student did not have a history of travel abroad and thought it was a seasonal flu, and [[Polymerase chain reaction|PCR]] test was not done in timely manner. Two other students are suspected, and 17 other students are claiming influenza-like symptoms. The route of the infection was not traceable.{{cite web |date=16 May 2009 |url=http://search.japantimes.co.jp/cgi-bin/nn20090516x1.html |title=First domestic case of H1NI flu infection confirmed in Japan |publisher=The Japan Times |accessdate=16 May 2009}} On 18 May, 130 cases had been confirmed, including employees of a railway kiosk and a bank. Several railway kiosks in Kobe were closed, and 70 other bank workers who had worked with the infected person were told to stand by at home. All schools in the [[Osaka Prefecture|Osaka]] and [[Hyogo Prefecture]]s were suspended. There have been 944 case confirmed in Japan as of 24 June 2009.{{cite web |url=http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2009-06/04/content_11486526.htm |title=Patients of A/H1N1 flu amount to 410 in Japan |publisher=Xinhua |date=4 June 2009 |accessdate=4 June 2009}} On 2 July, the first case of [[oseltamivir]]-resistant virus in Asia was announced in Japan, in a woman who had been taking Tamiflu prophylactically.Reuters, [https://www.reuters.com/article/internal_ReutersNewsRoom_ExclusivesAndWins_MOLT/idUSTRE5614TW20090702 "Japan finds first case of H1N1 resistant to Tamiflu"], ''Yoko Kubota'', 2 July 2009 =={{flag|Kazakhstan}}== The first cases of A(H1N1) virus were discovered in 3 students from the capital Astana according to Natalia Buenko, an advisor to the Ministry of Health of Kazakhstan.{{cite web| url=http://www.kt.kz/index.php?lang=eng&uin=1133435434&chapter=1153492722| title=Three students diagnosed with А/Н1N1 in Astana| date= 23 June 2009| publisher=Kazakhstan Today| accessdate= 22 October 2009 }} =={{flag|Kuwait}}== About 18 people on U.S. military bases in [[Kuwait]] have tested positive for swine flu, a [[U.S. Central Command]] spokeswoman said on 24 May 2009. They are the first cases reported in Kuwait. It remains unclear whether the virus has spread to the civilian population. The names and units of the infected people were not immediately available. Maj. Kristi Beckman, speaking from Central Command headquarters in [[Tampa]], said everyone who tested positive for the virus was quarantined in military health facilities approved by officials from the Kuwaiti Ministry of Health. The World Kuwait is used as a staging area for soldiers heading to or from the war in Iraq. The World Health Organization reported that they had not included Kuwait on its list of countries where the virus is present. On 16 June, the Kuwait Times newspaper reported confirmed the country's first cases of swine flu in four Kuwaitis who returned from the United States.{{cite web| url=http://www.kuwaittimes.net/read_news.php?newsid=ODY3ODAxNjc3| title=Swine flu reaches Kuwait| date=17 June 2009| publisher=Kuwait Times| accessdate=22 October 2009| archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090908135438/http://www.kuwaittimes.net/read_news.php?newsid=ODY3ODAxNjc3| archive-date=8 September 2009| dead-url=yes| df=dmy-all}} =={{flag|Laos}}== [[File:H1N1 Laos map.svg|200px|right|thumb|Outbreak evolution in Laos
{{legend|black|Deaths}}{{legend|red|Confirmed cases}}]] The [[Politics of Laos|Lao government]] agreed to buy 10 thermal imaging machines and install them at the country's major immigration border checkpoints. The machines would help officials identify anyone entering the country with a high temperature and create confidence among Lao people, foreigners living in [[Laos]] and people traveling to Laos. Health officials would be on hand at international border checkpoints to ensure anyone found to be infected could be treated immediately. Each machine could cost about US$25,000. The decision to buy them was made after the government found visitors to Laos included people coming from the United States, Spain and other affected countries. The Prime Minister [[Bouasone Bouphavanh]] said masks should be made available and health officials would be assigned to work at border checkpoints. The machines would help officials identify anyone entering the country with a high temperature and create confidence among Lao people, foreigners living in Laos and people travelling to Laos. Health officials would be on hand at international border checkpoints to ensure anyone found to be infected could be treated immediately. On 18 June, the first case in Laos was confirmed. {{cite web|title=Govt to make swine flu border checks|url=http://www.vientianetimes.org.la/FreeContent/Free_Govt.htm|publisher=Vientiane Times|accessdate=29 April 2009| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090502010026/http://www.vientianetimes.org.la/FreeContent/Free_Govt.htm| archivedate= 2 May 2009 | deadurl= no}} =={{flag|Lebanon}}== A Lebanese man suffering from a serious illness died from the H1N1 swine flu strain on Thursday 30 July 2009, which makes the first death in Lebanon, Health Minister Mohammad Khalifeh told Reuters. The 30-year-old victim had been receiving treatment for leukemia when he contracted the virus, possibly from relatives who had just traveled from Australia to Lebanon, the minister said.Lebanon has recorded more than 100 cases of H1N1.{{cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/internal_ReutersNewsRoom_ExclusivesAndWins_MOLT/idUSTRE56T6CJ20090730|title=Lebanon records first H1N1 death|publisher=Reuters|accessdate=30 July 2009 | date=30 July 2009}} The first three cases of swine flu were discovered in Lebanon on 1 July 2009 according to the Health Minister [[Mohammad Jawad Khalifeh]].{{cite web|url=http://www.dailystar.com.lb/article.asp?edition_id=1&categ_id=1&article_id=103682|title=Number of local swine flu cases rises to 43, says Health Ministry|publisher=The Daily Star|date=1 July 2009 |accessdate=1 July 2009}} "One Lebanese man who was in Spain and two Canadians who arrived in Lebanon a week ago are suffering from swine flu," Khalifeh told AFP. "We put them in quarantine and the blood samples we have taken every day have proven to be positive. "The Lebanese man and the two visiting Canadians were given the proper medical treatment in time and they are well now." He told a press conference said the man was part of a group of 22 Lebanese who had been attending a training seminar in Spain at an institute where the disease was later detected. He said health authorities may use thermal scanners at the airport to detect passengers with fever. "The situation is under control," he said. The Lebanese Health Minister Mohammad Jawad Khalifeh asked citizens to stop the social habit of greeting with kissing, as it is a Lebanese habit to greet each other with three kisses on the cheek. He also requested that affected schoolchildren be kept at home and that travel to countries in which cases have been confirmed be avoided.{{cite news|url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/lifestyleMolt/idUKTRE53R3D320090428 |title=Lebanese told not to kiss in anti-swine flu drive | Lifestyle | Reuters |publisher=Uk.reuters.com |date=9 February 2009 |accessdate=30 April 2009 |first=Nadim |last=Ladki| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090501145551/http://uk.reuters.com/article/lifestyleMolt/idUKTRE53R3D320090428| archivedate= 1 May 2009 | deadurl= no}} Beirut also banned the import of pork.{{cite web|url=http://foodbizdaily.com/articles/28988-swine-flu-fear-prompts-lebanon-to-ban-pork-imports.aspx |title=News: Swine flu Fear Prompts Lebanon to Ban Pork Imports |publisher=Foodbizdaily.com |date=22 February 1999 |accessdate=30 April 2009| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090503110754/http://foodbizdaily.com/articles/28988-swine-flu-fear-prompts-lebanon-to-ban-pork-imports.aspx| archivedate= 3 May 2009 | deadurl= yes}} On 30 May, Lebanon confirms three cases of swine flu.[http://blog.lebanesetag.com/2009/05/lebanon-confirms-three-swine-flu-cases.html LEBANESE TAG: * Lebanon Confirms Three Swine Flu Cases] =={{flag|Macau}}== On 18 June, the first case was confirmed. The victim was a Filipino arriving Macau the day before.{{cite web|url=http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2009-06/18/content_11562993.htm|title=Macao reports first confirmed A/H1N1 flu case|date=18 June 2009|publisher=Xinhua| accessdate= 22 October 2009 }} The first local case was confirmed on 23 June. On that day there were 8 confirmed cases.{{cite web|url=http://www.tdm.com.mo/c_radio/news/index.php?id=101147|title=Macao reports first confirmed local A/H1N1 flu case|date=23 June 2009|publisher=TDM| accessdate= 22 October 2009 }} =={{flag|Malaysia}}== {{Main article|2009 flu pandemic in Malaysia}} [[File:H1N1 Malaysia map.svg|360px|right|thumb|Outbreak evolution in Malaysia
{{legend|black|Deaths}}{{legend|red|Confirmed cases}}]] Malaysia detected the first case of influenza A(H1N1) on 15 May 2009 in a 21-year-old student who returned from the United States.{{cite web| url=http://thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=/2009/5/15/nation/20090515141134| title=Malaysia confirms first case of A(H1N1) flu (Update 2)| date=15 May 2009| publisher=TheStar Online| accessdate=22 October 2009| archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090519121627/http://thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=%2F2009%2F5%2F15%2Fnation%2F20090515141134| archive-date=19 May 2009| dead-url=yes| df=dmy-all}} Malaysia first case of Influenza A (H1N1) which was locally transmitted was confirmed on 17 June 2009 and identified as 17-year-old girl who was admitted to the [[Kuala Lumpur General Hospital|Kuala Lumpur Hospital]].{{cite web| url=http://thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=/2009/6/17/nation/20090617171933&sec=nation| title=A (H1N1): First locally-transmitted case confirmed (Update)| date=17 June 2009| publisher=TheStar Online| accessdate=22 October 2009| archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090901215021/http://thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=%2F2009%2F6%2F17%2Fnation%2F20090617171933&sec=nation| archive-date=1 September 2009| dead-url=yes| df=dmy-all}} As of 11 August 2009 there has been 2,253 confirmed cases in Malaysia.{{cite web| url=http://www.straitstimes.com/Breaking%2BNews/SE%2BAsia/Story/STIStory_415256.html| title= 6 new flu deaths in M'sia | date= 11 August 2009| publisher=Straits Times| accessdate= 22 October 2009 }} The Health Ministry has announced that from 12 August 2009 they had discontinued the counting of the total number of H1N1 cases in line with guidelines issued by the [[World Health Organization]].{{cite web|url=http://h1n1.moh.gov.my/ |title=Influenza A(H1N1): Death toll now 68 |date=20 August 2009 |publisher=Malaysia Ministry of Health |accessdate=22 October 2009 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090727164253/http://h1n1.moh.gov.my/ |archivedate=27 July 2009 |df= }} As of 20 August 2009 the total number of A(H1N1) related deaths in Malaysia stands at 68. =={{flag|Maldives}}== A ministerial committee has been established to supervise swine flu preventive measures to avoid an outbreak. All visitors arriving at the [[Malé]] International Airport on [[Hulule|Hulhule Island]] and the country’s three commercial seaports are being screened.{{cite web |title=Maldives prepares for swine flu |author=Ibrahim Mohamed |url=http://www.minivannews.com/news_detail.php?id=6428 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5hLBtXzRT?url=http://www.minivannews.com/news_detail.php?id=6428 |archivedate=7 June 2009 |date=30 April 2009 |accessdate=30 April 2009 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }} First death from H1N1 flu virus was confirmed on 19 November.http://www.miadhu.com.mv/2009/11/local-news/maldives-registers-first-swine-flu-death/{{dead link|date=June 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }} =={{flag|Mongolia}}== [[File:H1N1 Mongolia Map.svg|thumb|200px|right| {{legend|black|Deaths}}{{legend|red|Confirmed cases}}]] Mongolian authorities quarantined 103 plane passengers on last 7 May who may have been exposed to swine flu. The passengers were aboard a flight in which two passengers who had performed in a Mongolian band in Mexico developed a fever. When the plane stopped for a scheduled landing in Moscow, the ill passengers were hospitalized. Landing later in [[Ulaanbaatar]], the Mongolian Health Ministry announced it had quarantined all passengers as well as the crew of six. The people will remain under medical surveillance for seven days, according to officials of the General Authority for Emergency Management. The Mongolian Health Ministry has sought to prevent the spread of swine flu in Mongolia by urging people to avoid public places.[http://www.mongolia-web.com/health/2384-mongolia-quarantines-air-passengers-following-swine-flu-alert- Mongolia quarantines air passengers following swine flu alert | Mongolia Web News] As of 22 October 126 cases were confirmed in Mongolia. Just after seven days, the number increased to 394 with five deaths. =={{flag|North Korea}}== [[File:H1N1 North korea map.png|thumb|200px|right| {{legend|black|Deaths}}{{legend|red|Confirmed cases}}]] Most defectors with backgrounds in health care agree that, considering the isolation of North Korean society and its highly inadequate health care system, incidents of swine flu are likely to be either suppressed or merely misdiagnosed. Following the confirmation of the first case of the disease in Mongolia, heightened concerns arose. the very high cases in China would make the spread of the disease to North Korea only a matter of time. If swine flu would come to North Korea, there is a possibility of rapid spreading of the disease through the jangmadang (market), which has become the primary means of survival for the people. The plans of the WHO to distribute swine flu vaccines, contributed by developed countries, to a selected 100 developing countries in November; North Korea is included in the priority list.Yeol, Kim So (29 October 2009). [http://www.dailynk.com/english/read.php?cataId=nk00100&num=5588 Swine Flu in North Korea a Big Risk]. ''[[Daily NK]]''. On 16 November, the first known case was confirmed by the [[Ministry of Unification]], released in a report by ''[[Korea Times]]''. The first case was confirmed in a South Korean worker in Gaeseong Industrial Complex.[http://crofsblogs.typepad.com/h5n1/2009/11/north-koreas-first-h1n1-case-is-a-south-korean.html?no_prefetch=1 H5N1: North Korea's first H1N1 case is a South Korean] On 1 December, the Ministry of Public Health called on a meeting to discuss how to prevent H1N1 influenza from spreading. Importing of vaccines and isolation of people in their respective homes were considered. The Ministry of Education has also decided to call on all schools nationwide to have a winter break a month earlier in an approach to stop the spread of the disease due to the fact that the majority of fatalities caused by the disease are people younger than 23 years of age.[http://goodfriendsusa.blogspot.com/2009/12/north-korea-today-no-311no311-1-hot.html North Korea Today No. 311/No.311-1 Hot Topics December 2009]. Good Friends. However, on 9 December for the first time, North Korea officially confirmed foreign reports that an outbreak has occurred in the country,Hyun, Kim (9 December 2009). [http://english.yonhapnews.co.kr/northkorea/2009/12/09/43/0401000000AEN20091209001100315F.HTML N. Korea confirms H1N1 outbreak ]. [[Yonhap]]. and has accepted aid from South Korea.[https://www.google.com/hostednews/afp/article/ALeqM5ieQxDNWQ3oV5C8LN2j5BJK_p8hMQ N.Korea accepts S.Korea swine flu aid offer]. [[Agence France-Presse|AFP]]. 10 December 2009. However, there is propaganda that the United States and Western governments created the H1N1 virus, and that the disease is man-made by the Westerners. =={{flag|Oman}}== As of 13 August 2009, 337 cases have been confirmed by the National Pandemic Influenza Committee in Oman. There have also been unconfirmed reports of a death although this has been denied by the Health Ministry. on 21 August 2009, the Ministry of Health reported the first 2 death cases one in Muscat and the other in Salalah plus the increase in the number of cases to 513.{{cite web|title= Two die of flu in Sultanate|url=http://www.omantribune.com/index.php?page=news&id=53995&heading=Top%20News| accessdate= 22 October 2009 }} =={{flag|Pakistan}}== Pakistan has taken precautionary measures at the international airports to check passengers coming from swine flu affected countries.{{cite web|url=http://www.dawn.com/wps/wcm/connect/dawn-content-library/dawn/news/pakistan/14-pakistan-mobilises-against-swine-flu-officials-zj-04 |title= Pakistan mobilises against swine flu| date=29 April 2009|publisher=The Dawn| accessdate= 22 October 2009 }} Doctors are checking the incoming passengers and allow entry only to those with no flu symptoms. The major hospitals in all the big cities are on high alert. There are 90 confirmed case as of 26 January 2010.[http://geo.tv/1-27-2010/57936.htm Four new H1N1 cases confirmed in Karachi - GEO.tv] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110923124808/http://geo.tv/1-27-2010/57936.htm |date=23 September 2011 }} =={{flag|Philippines}}== [[File:Ph AH1N1 map.PNG|thumb|right| {{legend|black|Deaths}}{{legend|darkred|Confirmed community outbreak}}{{legend|red|Confirmed cases}}{{legend|yellow|Suspected cases}}]] {{Main article|2009 flu pandemic in the Philippines}} Health Secretary Francisco T. Duque III ordered the Bureau of Quarantine to use thermal imaging equipment at airports to screen passengers coming from the US for flu symptoms.{{cite web|url=http://mb.com.ph/articles/203772/quarantine-screening-us-passengers-ordered|title=Quarantine screening of US passengers ordered | Manila Bulletin|publisher=Mb.com.ph|date=|accessdate=26 April 2009|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090429172557/http://mb.com.ph/articles/203772/quarantine-screening-us-passengers-ordered|archivedate=29 April 2009|deadurl=yes|df=dmy-all}}[http://www.earthtimes.org/articles/show/266059,philippines-steps-up-airport-screening-against-swine-flu.html The Philippines' may quarantine travelers] with [[Swine flu]] Symptoms The Philippines may quarantine travelers arriving from Mexico with fevers.{{cite news|url=http://wtop.com/?nid=383&sid=1660299|title=WHO declares international concern over swine flu|author=Frank Jordans|date=25 April 2009|agency=Associated Press| accessdate= 22 October 2009 }} Also, the Secretary of the [[Department of Agriculture (Philippines)|Department of Agriculture]] issued an order banning the importation of hogs from the U.S. and Mexico, and the retraction of the restriction of swine influenza vaccine use.{{cite web|url=http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/nation/04/25/09/rp-bans-pork-hogs-us-mexico|title=RP bans pork, hogs from US, Mexico|publisher=[[ABS-CBN Broadcasting Corporation|ABS-CBN]]|date=26 April 2009|accessdate=26 April 2009| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090427102102/http://www.abs-cbnnews.com/nation/04/25/09/rp-bans-pork-hogs-us-mexico| archivedate= 27 April 2009 | deadurl= no}} The medical alert phase is already [[Code White]], the lowest.{{cite web|url=http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2009-04/29/content_11282377.htm|title=Philippines on high alert against swine flu|publisher=news.xinhuanet.com|date=|accessdate=1 May 2009| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090502215746/http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2009-04/29/content_11282377.htm| archivedate= 2 May 2009 | deadurl= no}} On 18 May 2009, a Filipina girl who arrived from [[Houston, Texas|Houston]], [[Texas]], United States was the first confirmed case of H1N1 virus in the Philippines. Health Secretary Duque advised that the girl is in stable condition and is in quarantine.{{cite web|url=http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/breakingnews/nation/view/20090521-206396/DoH-confirms-first-AH1N1-case-in-RP|title=DoH confirms first A(H1N1) case in RP|author=Anna Valmero|date=21 May 2009|accessdate=22 October 2009|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090525104432/http://newsinfo.inquirer.net/breakingnews/nation/view/20090521-206396/DoH-confirms-first-AH1N1-case-in-RP|archive-date=25 May 2009|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} On 3 June 2009, a foreign exchange student in [[De La Salle University]]-Manila was confirmed with H1N1 virus and the school was closed for ten days starting 4 June.{{cite news|url=http://www.gmanews.tv/story/164048/A(H1N1)-cases-now-29-including-ADB-staff---DOH|title=RE : Confirmed case of Influenza A and campus closure|last=Br. Armin A. Luistro FSC, President and Chancellor|date=3 June 2009|accessdate=3 June 2009}} As of 5 June 2009, the Total of confirmed cases of A(H1N1) virus rose from 29 cases last 4 June to 33 confirmed cases as of 5 June. Philippine Health Secretary Francisco Duque III said the new cases are two siblings and another student of De La Salle University.{{cite news|url=http://www.gmanews.tv/story/164186/DOH-Confirmed-A(H1N1)-infections-in-RP-now-at-33|title= A(H1N1) virus from 29 rose to 33 in RP|date=5 June 2009|accessdate=5 June 2009}} Because of the said incident, on 6 June 2009, the Commission in Higher Education [CHED] moved the opening of classes in all colleges and universities in Metro Manila from 8 June 2009 to 15 June 2009. First fatality was reported, a 49-year-old female from [[Metro Manila]] on 22 June, the first fatality in Asia of this disease.{{cite news|url=http://www.doh.gov.ph/h1n1/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=120:update-no-48-duque-reports-high-risk-patient-who-dies-of-heart-attack-found-with-ah1n184-if-all-reported-cases-have-fully-recovered&catid=35:daily-influenza-a-h1n1-updates&Itemid=61 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090630162346/http://www.doh.gov.ph/h1n1/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=120%3Aupdate-no-48-duque-reports-high-risk-patient-who-dies-of-heart-attack-found-with-ah1n184-if-all-reported-cases-have-fully-recovered&catid=35%3Adaily-influenza-a-h1n1-updates&Itemid=61 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=30 June 2009 |title=Update No. 48 - Duque Reports High Risk Patient who Dies of Heart Attack Found with A(h1N1);84% if all Reported Cases have Fully Recovered |publisher=Department of Health |accessdate=22 June 2009 |df= }} {{cite news|url=http://ph.news.yahoo.com/ap/20090622/tap-as-philippines-swine-flu-fe2a5de.html|title=Philippines reports first swine flu fatality|date=22 June 2009|accessdate=22 June 2009| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090625152243/http://ph.news.yahoo.com/ap/20090622/tap-as-philippines-swine-flu-fe2a5de.html| archivedate= 25 June 2009 | deadurl= yes}} The death was not caused by the virus directly. The person has lung and health problems that worsen it. The person died of a heart attack.{{Citation needed|date=July 2009}} The highest confirmed in one day was on 24 June 2009 with 131 cases,[http://quintessentialy.wordpress.com/2009/06/24/131-new-h1n1-cases-total-up-to-604-–-doh/ 131 new H1N1 cases, total up to 604] the next day, the confirmed cases added is 123. Because of that, the Department of Health ordered the people that should get swab tests are the only people with very complicated cases (e.g. with [[lung diseases|lung disorders]], [[heart disease|hearth disorders]], [[babies]] etc.). The government said that the very fast spreading of the disease is caused by the population density of the country. =={{flag|Russia}}== {{Further|2009 flu pandemic in Europe#Russia{{!}}2009 flu pandemic in Europe}} =={{flag|Saudi Arabia}}== The Health Ministry has announced the detection of a case of swine flu which infected a Filipino nurse working at [[King Faisal Specialist Hospital and Research Center]]. Dr Abdullah al-Rabee'a, the Health Minister, said that the detection of the case has come within the framework of the efforts being exerted by the Health Ministry to follow up developments in this respect. In a statement to the Saudi Press Agency, he said that the nurse, who had spent her holidays in Philippines, returned to Riyadh on 29 May 2009, aboard one of the flights of the [[Gulf Air]]. "Symptoms of the disease appeared in the case of the nurse on June 1, 2009, and she was admitted to the KFSHRC for conducting the required medical examinations pertaining to Swine Flu, he said, noting that the results of the medical examinations were disclosed on Tuesday evening, confirming the case as 'Positive'". In the light of the measures of the World Health Organization (WHO), the medical examinations were conducted for the second time on Tuesday evening, he said, adding that the examinations proved the infection of the nurse for A/H1N1 on Wednesday morning. Dr Al-Rabee'a said the Health Ministry in cooperation with King Faisal Specialist Hospital and Research Center has applied the national plan for the prevention of swine flu in a manner that matches with the recommendations of WHO. Accordingly, the patient was isolated and provided with the required medical treatment. Arrangements are underway to examine those who were in contact with the patient to get sure that they are not infected.[http://www.spa.gov.sa/English/details.php?id=670933 saudi Press agency] As of 17 August 2009 the number of A(H1N1) cases in Saudi Arabia have increased to above 700 and 14 people have died.{{cite news| url=http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/News/News-By-Industry/Indian-dies-of-swine-flu-in-Saudi-Arabia/articleshow/4900370.cms | work=The Times Of India | title=News By Industry | date=17 August 2009| accessdate= 22 October 2009 }} By 17 August, There had been about 2000 cases of the flu resulting in 14 deaths. =={{flag|Singapore}}== The '''2009 flu pandemic in Singapore''' was an [[influenza pandemic]] involving the [[influenza A virus subtype H1N1]].{{cite news|url=http://www.asiaone.com/Health/News/Story/A1Story20101022-243602.html |title=New strain of swine flu emerges in Singapore |first=Maggie |last=Fox |newspaper=[[AsiaOne]] |date=22 October 2010 |accessdate=2 November 2012 }}{{cite news|url=http://www.channelnewsasia.com/stories/singaporelocalnews/view/438422/1/.html |title=Polyclinics to set up special stations to treat H1N1 flu cases |first=Satish |last=Cheney |newspaper=[[Channel News Asia]] |date=25 June 2009 |accessdate=2 November 2012 }} It was part of an epidemic that occurred in 2009 of the H1N1 virus, causing what was commonly known as [[swine flu]].{{cite web|url=https://fpc.state.gov/documents/organization/128854.pdf |title= The 2009 Influenza Pandemic: An Overview - Foreign Press Centre |publisher=Foreign Press Centre |accessdate=2 November 2012 }} On 30 April 2009, the [[Ministry of Health (Singapore)|Singapore Ministry of Health]] raised its Disease Outbreak Response System to "Alert Orange". At this time, there were no confirmed cases in Singapore.The first case of the H1N1 virus in Singapore was confirmed on 27 May 2009, in which a then 22-year-old woman picked up the virus after visiting [[New York City]], United States.{{cite news |url=http://thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=/2009/5/27/nation/20090527113303&sec=nation |title=Singapore records first A (H1N1) flu case |date=27 May 2009 |newspaper=[[The Star (Malaysia)|The Star]] |accessdate=2 November 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120907173739/http://thestar.com.my/news/story.asp?file=%2F2009%2F5%2F27%2Fnation%2F20090527113303&sec=nation |archive-date=7 September 2012 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }} As of 7 July 2009, there were 1,217 confirmed cases.{{cite web|url=http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2009-06/21/content_11574449.htm |title=Singapore confirms 23 new flu A/ H1N1 cases |date=21 June 2009 |publisher=xinhua |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5jeGId29a?url=http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2009-06/21/content_11574449.htm |archivedate=9 September 2009 |deadurl=no |accessdate=8 September 2009 |df=dmy }} As of 17 October 2009, there were 18 confirmed deaths from the H1N1 virus in Singapore.{{cite web|url=http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2009-07/22/content_11755009.htm |title=Singapore reports two more A/H1N1 related deaths |date=22 June 2009 |publisher=xinhua |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/5jeHdE8cn?url=http://news.xinhuanet.com/english/2009-07/22/content_11755009.htm |archivedate=9 September 2009 |deadurl=no |accessdate=8 September 2009 |df=dmy }} On 12 February 2010, the Singapore Ministry of Health moved its alert level to Green. =={{flag|Sri Lanka}}{{anchor|Sri Lanka}}== The first case of Influenza A (H1N1-2009) was confirmed on '''16 June,''' 2009 in Sri Lanka. Sri Lanka said on Tuesday that a 12-year-old girl returning home from Singapore was diagnosed with A(H1N1) influenza, the island's first swine flu case. The student was moved to the Infectious Diseases Hospital on the outskirts of the capital, a health ministry official said. As of 25 June there were 10 confirmed cases. According to Geetani Wickremasinghe of Medical Research Institute in Colombo another two people suffering from swine flu have been detected on Wednesday 24 June. Both patients who were from Australia, including a ten-year-old boy have reached the country on last Sunday. With these two patients added to the total number of Swine Flu patients detected in Sri Lanka has risen to 10. Four of the patients have been discharged, but six patients are still receiving treatments at the Infectious Disease Hospital in Angoda.{{cite web| url=http://www.colombopage.com/archive_091/Jun1245938550RA.html| title=Swine Flu cases in Sri Lanka rising day by day | date=25 June 2009 | publisher=ColomboPage| accessdate= 22 October 2009 }} =={{flag|South Korea}}== South Korea warned against travel to Mexico City and three Mexican states. The government has also stepped up quarantine and safety checks on travelers arriving from the United States and Mexico, and pork imports from those countries. An emergency quarantine system is also in place, with simple tests conducted on people arriving with flu symptoms at airports. On 28 April, South Korea reported its first probable case of swine flu after positive preliminary tests on a nun who had recently returned from a trip to Mexico.[http://health.asiaone.com/Health/News/Story/A1Story20090428-138037.html SKorean woman 'probably' has swine flu: health agency. From Asiaone], 28 April 2009. Several sources have informed that one case has been confirmed by lab in South Korea, on 30 April.{{cite web|url=http://www.swivel.com/graphs/show/33115823 |title=Swine Flu: Lab Confirmed Cases by Country |publisher=Swivel |date= |accessdate=1 May 2009| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090502004758/http://www.swivel.com/graphs/show/33115823| archivedate= 2 May 2009 | deadurl= no}}{{cite web|url=https://maps.google.com/maps/ms?msa=0&msid=108544464229376653670.00046882ec31a0adcb220 |title=Swine Flu Interactive Map - Google Maps |publisher=Maps.google.com |date=1 January 1970 |accessdate=1 May 2009}} On 2 May, the first suspected woman turned out to be infected with the influenza A subtype H1N1. South Korea became the third infected nation in Asia, after Israel and Hong Kong. There have been approx. 2100 cases in S.Korea as of 16 August 2009.{{cite web|url=http://news.sbs.co.kr/section_news/news_read.jsp?news_id=N1000586383 |title=the first suspected is 'confirmed' as new influenza infected in S.Korea |publisher=SBS |date=2 May 2009 |accessdate=2 May 2009| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20090504022913/http://news.sbs.co.kr/section_news/news_read.jsp?news_id=N1000586383| archivedate= 4 May 2009 | deadurl= no}} On 15 August, the first Korean death by the new influenza was confirmed publicly and a second death was announced on 16 August. Around 15000 cases and 14 deaths have been reported as of 12 October 2009. =={{flag|Republic of China}} [[Republic of China|Taiwan (Republic of China)]] == {{Main article|2009 flu pandemic in Taiwan}} [[File:H1N1 Taiwan map.svg|thumb|150px|Outbreak evolution in Taiwan/ROC:
{{legend|#FF0000|Confirmed cases}}{{legend|#000000|Deaths}}]] On 20 May 2009, the first case of the influenza has been confirmed in [[Taiwan]].[http://www.chinapost.com.tw/health/infectious-diseases/2009/05/20/208865/Taiwan-issues.htm Taiwan issues phase 2 warning after 1st swine flu case confirmed]. [[The China Post]] The government had previously taken several steps to prevent the possible outbreak of Swine Flu, including a command center set up, travel alerts for infected nations,[http://english.cna.com.tw/SearchNews/doDetail.aspx?id=200904280012 MOFA issues red travel alert for Mexico on swine fluu]. [[Central News Agency (Republic of China)|CNA]] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090429235551/http://english.cna.com.tw/SearchNews/doDetail.aspx?id=200904280012 |date=29 April 2009 }} and more severe health check been conducted at international ports. Taiwan said visitors who came back from affected areas with fever would be quarantined.[https://www.google.com/hostednews/ap/article/ALeqM5g-G1kSAM9yaH00eBrXD2S5s-3ZhgD97Q5KVO0 WHO tries to come up with swine flu plan]. [[Associated Press]] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090430205920/https://www.google.com/hostednews/ap/article/ALeqM5g-G1kSAM9yaH00eBrXD2S5s-3ZhgD97Q5KVO0 |date=30 April 2009 }} According to [[Department of Health (Republic of China)|The Department of Health]] (DOH), Taiwan has a sufficient supply of surgical masks and vaccine to deal with the flu. The DOH also stated that they have 50 million to 60 million masks in stock and local manufacturers have the capability of producing 200,000 doses of the flu vaccine a month.[http://english.cna.com.tw/SearchNews/doDetail.aspx?id=200904280017 Taiwan sets up command center to counter swine flu]{{dead link|date=December 2010}}. [[Central News Agency (Republic of China)|CNA]] In an effort to prevent the entry of the swine influenza, the Centers for Disease Control has announced on 28 April that every flight from the Americas, specifically Canada and the United States, that arrives in Taiwan from 29 April and onward will be subject to a strict on-board screening procedure. There are 5,474 confirmed cases of H1N1 in Taiwan so far.[http://english.cna.com.tw/SearchNews/doDetail.aspx?id=200904280023 Taiwan to launch on-board flu checks on flights from America]. [[Central News Agency (Republic of China)|CNA]] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090724012333/http://english.cna.com.tw/SearchNews/doDetail.aspx?id=200904280023 |date=24 July 2009 }} =={{flag|Thailand}}== [[File:H1N1 Thailand map.png|200px|right|thumb|Outbreak evolution in Thailand
{{legend|black|Deaths}}{{legend|red|Confirmed cases}}{{legend|yellow|Suspected cases}}]] The '''2009 flu pandemic in Thailand''', part of an [[epidemic]] in 2009 of a new strain of [[influenza A virus subtype H1N1]] causing what has been commonly called [[swine influenza|swine flu]], made its first confirmed appearance in [[Thailand]] on 13 May 2009, when Thailand confirmed two cases of swine flu. Both of the individuals confirmed as having swine flu had recently traveled to Mexico.
